New Records: Pete Alonso hit a three-run home run in the first inning and the Mets piled up five runs in the third on the way to an 8-1 lead, then held on to cut the deficit to 3-2 in the best-of-seven National League Championship Series.
Key Match Events: The Mets kept their magical season going, beating the Los Angeles Dodgers 12-6 on Friday to stay alive in their Major League Baseball playoff series.
Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets kept their magical season going, beating the Los Angeles Dodgers 12-6 on Friday to stay alive in their Major League Baseball playoff series.
Post-Match Reflections: The winner of the series will take on either the New York Yankees or Cleveland Guardians in the World Series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets, with their backs against the wall, came out firing. They seized a 3-0 lead in the bottom of the first on Alonso's towering home run to center field that also scored Lindor and Brandon Nimmo â€” who had singled and walked.
